articles.headline: Uber Fires 20 Amid Investigation Into Workplace Culture
articles.snippet: The company was said to have disclosed the move at an all-hands meeting at its San Francisco headquarters on Tuesday.
articles.abstract: The company was said to have disclosed the move at an all-hands meeting at its San Francisco headquarters on Tuesday.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — Uber has fired 20 employees over harassment, discrimination and inappropriate behavior, as the ride-hailing company tries to contain the fallout from a series of toxic revelations about its workplace.

articles.headline: How Bots Are Inflating Instagram Egos
articles.snippet: That stranger who said the photo of your dinner was “spectacular”? We’re sorry to say it was probably a bot, carrying out a rogue marketing tactic.
articles.abstract: That stranger who said the photo of your dinner was “spectacular”? We’re sorry to say it was probably a bot, carrying out a rogue marketing tactic.
articles.lead_paragraph: I posted a picture in March of the New York Times headquarters looking serene before a snowstorm to my Instagram account. The photo attracted 11 comments, all from strangers. “Very nice!” a monthly cocktail delivery company in San Francisco wrote. A cosmetic tattoo artist in Vancouver, British Columbia, posted three fire symbol emojis, and a vintage furniture seller in San Jose, Calif., left an emoji of a heart with a bow around it.

articles.headline: Public-Private Projects Where the Public Pays and Pays
articles.snippet: The Trump administration is talking up the promise of private investment in public infrastructure. Experts question the long-term benefits.
articles.abstract: The Trump administration is talking up the promise of private investment in public infrastructure. Experts question the long-term benefits.
articles.byline: By Matthew Goldstein and Patricia Cohen

articles.headline: Comey Told Sessions: Don’t Leave Me Alone With Trump
articles.snippet: The F.B.I. director did not tell the attorney general why a meeting the day before with President Trump, in which the president sought to end an investigation, had unnerved him.
articles.abstract: The F.B.I. director did not tell the attorney general why a meeting the day before with President Trump, in which the president sought to end an investigation, had unnerved him.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The day after President Trump asked James B. Comey, the F.B.I. director, to end an investigation into his former national security adviser, Mr. Comey confronted Attorney General Jeff Sessions and said he did not want to be left alone again with the president, according to current and former law enforcement officials.
articles.byline: By Michael S. Schmidt and Matt Apuzzo

articles.headline: Ponzi Scheme Meets Ransomware for a Doubly Malicious Attack
articles.snippet: As more of our lives go online, online attackers are finding increasingly creative ways to wreak havoc using ransomware, and now, pyramid schemes.
articles.abstract: As more of our lives go online, online attackers are finding increasingly creative ways to wreak havoc using ransomware, and now, pyramid schemes.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — The first message to pop up on the computer screen let the victims know they had been hacked. The second message gave them a way out.

articles.headline: What You Get (and What You Don’t) From a $50 Amazon Fire
articles.snippet: The newest versions of Amazon’s tablets, starting at $50, are unabashedly slow and unflashy, but just capable enough to be worth the cheap price.
articles.abstract: The newest versions of Amazon’s tablets, starting at $50, are unabashedly slow and unflashy, but just capable enough to be worth the cheap price.
articles.lead_paragraph: What can $50 buy? An inexpensive pair of sneakers, maybe dinner for two in San Francisco or a couple of tickets to the ballgame. But few ever imagined that it could also buy a tablet computer capable of running apps and streaming Netflix.

articles.headline: London Attackers Slipped By Despite an Avalanche of Warnings
articles.snippet: Revelations about three assailants tumbled into the open, raising pressure on Prime Minister Theresa May to explain how the signs were missed.
articles.abstract: Revelations about three assailants tumbled into the open, raising pressure on Prime Minister Theresa May to explain how the signs were missed.
articles.lead_paragraph: LONDON — Islamic State propaganda had been found in the bag of one attacker while he was trying to board a flight in Italy. An F.B.I. informant said he had raised alarms about the second attacker two years ago. The third attacker, denied asylum in Britain, appeared to have sneaked in from Ireland.
articles.byline: By Rukmini Callimachi and Katrin Bennhold

articles.headline: Robot Cars Can’t Count on Us in an Emergency
articles.snippet: Scientists call it the “handoff” problem. How do you keep humans focused enough to take control of a self-driving car in an emergency?
articles.abstract: Scientists call it the “handoff” problem. How do you keep humans focused enough to take control of a self-driving car in an emergency?
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — Three years ago, Google’s self-driving car project abruptly shifted from designing a vehicle that would drive autonomously most of the time while occasionally requiring human oversight, to a slow-speed robot without a brake pedal, accelerator or steering wheel. In other words, human driving was no longer permitted.

articles.headline: At Least 12 Killed in Pair of Terrorist Attacks in Iran
articles.snippet: At least 46 others were wounded in the two attacks. The Islamic State claimed responsibility. The near-simultaneous assaults lasted for hours.
articles.abstract: At least 46 others were wounded in the two attacks. The Islamic State claimed responsibility. The near-simultaneous assaults lasted for hours.
articles.lead_paragraph: Armed assailants, including some disguised as women, stunned Iran on Wednesday with brazen attacks on the Parliament building and the tomb of its revolutionary founder, the worst terrorist strike to hit the Islamic republic in years.
articles.byline: By Thomas Erdbrink and Mujib Mashal
